Stem: Narrow, long. Densely packed forming a tussock.
Leaves: Narrow, rough textured blades that are rolled-inward, and up to 60 cm long.
Flowers: Shiny branching heads up to 30 cm long. Spikelets within have white or straw coloured bracts up to 1.8 cm long.
FruitSeeds: 5-7.5 mm  long and with very long 4.5-9 cm long awns attached to a crown-like structure.
Habitat: Roadsides, degraded land, grasslands, open woodlands, pastures.
DistinguishingFeatures: Difficult to distinguish from other exotic Needlegrasses (*Nassella* species) but can be distinguished from native spear grasses (*Austrostipa* and *Poa* species) by crown-like structure below seed awns.
